block_comment: The block of code is responsible for comparing a specific section of an "addr_out" bus with a corresponding section of an "end_addr_i" bus and accordingly setting the "gen_addr_larger" flag. On the rising edge of the system clock signal 'clk_i', it compares the higher 24 bits (from bit 8 to bit 31) of the "addr_out" and "end_addr_i". If the "addr_out" is greater than or equal to "end_addr_i", it sets the "gen_addr_larger" flag to 1, indicating that the output address has crossed the defined boundary. Otherwise, it sets the flag to 0.
